name: Custom Python Tool
description: Structuredtool dataclass code tool (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
import ast
from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, BoolInput, DropdownInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data

from langchain.agents import Tool
from langchain_core.tools import StructuredTool

from axiestudio.schema.dotdict import dotdict

class CustomPythonTool(Component):
    display_name = "Custom Python Tool"
    description = "Structuredtool dataclass code tool"
    documentation = "https://python.langchain.com/docs/modules/tools/custom_tools/#structuredtool-dataclass"
    icon = "üêç"
    name = "CustomPythonTool"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="tool_name",
            display_name="Tool Name",
            info="Enter the name of the tool.",
            placeholder="My Tool",
            required=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="description",
            display_name="Description",
            info="Provide a brief description of what the tool does.",
            placeholder="This tool does something.",
            required=True,
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="tool_code",
            display_name="Tool Code",
            info="Enter the dataclass code here.",
            placeholder="def my_function():\n    pass",
            required=True,
            refresh_button=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="return_direct",
            display_name="Return Direct",
            info="Return the output directly.",
            value=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="tool_function",
            display_name="Tool Function",
            info="Select the function for additional expressions.",
            placeholder="my_function",
            options=[],
            refresh_button=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="tool_class",
            display_name="Tool Class",
            info="Select the class for additional expressions.",
            placeholder="MyClass",
            options=[],
            refresh_button=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Tool", name="tool", method="build_tool"),
    ]
    
    def parse_source_name(self, code: str) -> Dict:
        self.log("Parsing source code")
        parsed_code = ast.parse(code)
        class_names = [node.name for node in parsed_code.body if isinstance(node, ast.ClassDef)]
        function_names = [node.name for node in parsed_code.body if isinstance(node, ast.FunctionDef)]
        return {"class": class_names, "function": function_names}
    
    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dotdict, field_value: Any, field_name: str | None = None) -> dotdict:
        self.log("Updating build config A")
        if field_name == "tool_code" or field_name == "tool_function" or field_name == "tool_class":
            try:
                names = self.parse_source_name(build_config.tool_code.value)
                build_config.tool_class.options = names["class"]
                build_config.tool_function.options = names["function"]
            except Exception as e:
                self.status = f"Failed to extract class names: {str(e)}"
                build_config.tool_class.options = ["Failed to parse", str(e)]
                build_config.tool_function.options = []
        return build_config

    def build_output(self) -> Data:
        self.log("Building output 1")
        self.log("Building output 2")
        data = Data(value=self.tool_name)
        self.status = data
        return data
    
    def build_tool(self) -> Tool:
        self.log("Building tool")
        local_namespace = {}  # type: ignore
        exec(self.tool_code, globals(), local_namespace)
        
        func = local_namespace[self.tool_function]
        _class = None
        
        if self.tool_class:
            _class = local_namespace[self.tool_class]
        
        tool = StructuredTool.from_function(
            func=func,
            args_schema=_class,
            name=self.tool_name,
            description=self.description,
            return_direct=self.return_direct,
        )
        
        return tool

description.info: Provide a brief description of what the tool does.
